Adding Workfiles

Complete the following procedure to add existing files, directories, or directory trees to a project or project database.

NOTE: If you are adding workfiles to a 5.3/6.0 project, you must choose the archive directory in which you want to place the workfile archives in the Archive Location list.

To add workfiles:

  1. Select the project database, project, or folder to which you want to add workfiles.

  2. Select File | Add Workfiles. The Add Workfiles dialog box appears.

  3. In the Add Workfiles From field, enter the location of the workfiles you want to add or click the browse button to select a location.

    Note: If you specify a path with a filter other than * or *.* (for example, if you specify c:\files\*.cpp), the files matching the filter will be added directly without creating a top-level project. However, if subdirectories are also added, subprojects will be created for them and only files matching the filter will be added.

  4. For 5.3/6.0 projects: In the Archive Location field, select the location in which to create the archive from the archive directories specified in the configuration file. (For non 5.3/6.0 projects, archives are created in the archive location set for the project database or project.)

  5. Enter an archive description for the files you are adding in the Description field. You are required to enter a description for the files you are adding; the OK button is not enabled until you enter a description.

  6. Click OK to accept the default options, or use the Add Workfiles dialog box to override default options.
